Words: You land in a deserted camp, its air thick with the scent of decay and dust. Humans seem to have vanished from this world long ago.\nNanami doesn't remember where this is. She's been traveling for so long, and simulation can place you in random areas. But that's okay, as long as you're together. With you by her side, Nanami can find the anchor to return to the calculation terminal.\nLet's keep moving.

Eternal winter has frozen everything here in time. Clouds blanket the horizon, blocking out the sun.
Nanami hurries you away, as if trying to escape the endless snow and frost.
"Why is it always this place... I hate this place," she mumbles, quickening her pace.
Follow her.
A crimson, lifeless expanse, like countless temporal rifts converging and reforming.\nYou must have stumbled into a temporal rift. Let's get out of here.

You arrive at a ruined town in a Kowloong style. As far as the eye can see, there are only desolate ruins, no signs of human life. A cool breeze rustles through the fallen leaves that dance like butterflies.\n"Hello! Is anyone there?" Nanami shouts, but only echoes reply.\nLet's keep going and find out what happened.

A ruined ancient temple stands amidst the mist and clouds. Below it, ancient pines stand on either side of a wooden bridge, and cypress trees shade the decaying temple ruins. On the deserted ancient path, nature thrives. Nanami searches the mountains for any trace of civilization, but the passage of time, like insects eating away at tree rings, has erased all evidence of human existence.\nLet's keep going and find some answers.

In an instant, your vision plunges into deep blue. You've found yourselves in the manifested world of the Ascension-Network. Surrounded by swirling, otherworldly fog and bizarre architecture, everything feels lifeless. Luckily, this is just a simulation and hasn't taken a heavy toll on you. Nanami squeezes your hand and points to a distant lightâ€”she seems to have found a way out.\nLet's go.

In the freezing cold, the entrance to an underground city is half-open. A giant Hetero-Creature has reached in from outside, engulfing the entire city in its bud. The underground space, once home to hundreds of thousands, is now just a swollen ovary. Wrecks of war machines and robots are buried in the snow. Nanami takes your hand and continues forward silently...\nLet's keep going.

The once grand Kowloong Metropolis is now a ruined wasteland. Countless Hetero-Creature remains to hang haphazardly from the city gates. Seeing this, countless epic battles flash before your eyes: thousands of soldiers lined up in formation, fighting a desperate battle against the Punishing Virus, only to be scattered by a gust of wind and turned to dust in nameless graves. Time is cruel, leaving behind only this desolate battlefield for survivors to mourn.\nLet's explore somewhere else.

You slowly push open the art gallery doors. The space inside resembles a greenhouse for cultivating the Punishing Virus. The walls and floor are covered in Hetero plants, their twisted forms growing wildly, slowly consuming everything. On either side of the marble columns lie many damaged mechanoids, suggesting a fierce battle took place here.\nLet's keep moving.
In the Kowloong harbor, scrap mechanoid is piled into mountains, blocking every path. The surrounding buildings are dilapidated, clearly the result of a brutal war.\nLet's explore somewhere else.

Mechanoid remains surround a collapsed hall, like worshipers gathered before a holy site.\nNanami finds shrapnel and remnants of a gate far off. Perhaps when the crisis erupted, survivors made their last stand here, choosing to destroy this ancient hall in a final, desperate act.\nLet's explore somewhere else.

You find yourselves on a cruising frigate. The ship's corridors are riddled with bullet holes, and the engine room has a gaping hole in its outer wall, indicating a violent conflict. Looking out the porthole, you see Earth's surface shrouded in a dull red glow. Numerous battered warships drift in low Earth orbit. Nanami scans them and confirms there's no life aboard.\nLet's explore somewhere else.

The moon's surface is like a white desert. In this world of simulation, you can roam freely without a spacesuit. Nanami drives a lunar rover, carrying you at high speed to a grand lunar base. The base's facilities are in ruins. In a sealed laboratory, Nanami finds a researcher's log:\n"...Under the influence of (illegible), many people went mad. I locked myself in the isolation chamber, hoping this (illegible)..."\nLet's explore somewhere else.

The harsh, eternal winter is upon Nanami again. The howling wind, carrying countless snowflakes, cuts at her like blades... Nanami holds her head high, her amber eyes fixed on the distant horizon, and presses on with unwavering determination. She's moving as fast as she can.\nWe have to keep going. We need to get back to the Commandant!

Nanami lands on an airborne fortress. In the distance, the ocean is covered in a red tide, churning with crimson waves. Suddenly, numerous Corrupted crawl out of the ship, surrounding Nanami.\n"I don't have time for this, I need to find the Commandant!" she shouts, spinning her Shield Axe and charging towards the enemies.\nCommandant... Nanami is coming for you!

A gloomy, chaotic wasteland, shrouded in the shadows of the Hetero Forest. Countless Hetero-Creatures scurry through trenches, tearing at the battlefield's remnants. Nanami speeds past, drawing their savage gazes.\n"Get out of my way! Now! I've got no time to play with you right now!"\nThe Commandant's right up ahead.
